SD.synopsis: Tara rejoins Gale, offering him a magic item and reminding him of his plight.
SD.how_to_trigger: Use Companion debug Book(Ctrl+Shift+7)Gale> Act 1 > Tara the Tressym

SD_31.speaker: Narrator
SD_31.text: *Sleep is a hazy oasis on the far side of a desert of worry.*
SD_31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is lying restless on his bedroll, unable to sleep

SD_25.speaker: Narrator
SD_25.text: *You know exactly what this illithid parasite will do to you. Within seven days, you'll become a mind flayer.*

SD_49.speaker: Narrator
SD_49.text: *But what about the bomb in your chest? Ceremorphosis is likely to destabilise it. What then?*

SD_43.speaker: Gale
SD_43.text: Consider that it'll explode, flattening an area larger than Waterdeep.

SD_34.speaker: Narrator
SD_34.text: *You try to think of something else but it's no good.*

SD_16.speaker: Narrator
SD_16.text: *You imagine the explosion. Thousands will die. You have to stop it - ceremorphosis and the orb itself.*

SD_46.speaker: Gale
SD_46.text: Think of Mystra, goddess of magic.

SD_53.speaker: Narrator
SD_53.text: *She was furious when she realised what you'd done. Seeking control, trying to prove yourself her equal. You were in love with her. Now you're a danger to everyone you know.*

SD_15.speaker: Narrator
SD_15.text: *Your mistakes have been huge. The consequences... memorable. But you won't let anyone die. You can't.*

SD_10.speaker: Narrator
SD_10.text: *You'll need to drain magical energy from a powerful artefact soon. As you contemplate your hubris, your eyelids grow heavier and heavier...*
SD_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Fade to black. Gale falls asleep.NodeContext: GAle falling asleep toward the end, can be stretched out a little

SD_48.speaker: Tara the Tressym
SD_48.text: Excuse me, Mr Dekarios. Mr Dekarios. Yoo-hoo!
SD_48.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dialogue opens to a black screen on a camp morning. We hear Tara's voice through the blackness.

SD_51.speaker: Tara the Tressym
SD_51.text: Destiny is at your door; won't you at least twitch the curtain?
SD_51.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Gale startles awake and jumps to his feet, revealing a winged cat perched on an object (stump? chair? whatever will help Tara be at Gale's eye-level while he's standing. The idea is that their dialogue will be cheap from here on out, i.e. Gale won't have to talk and emote while sitting or laying down, but standing in normal position).

SD_17.speaker: Tara the Tressym
SD_17.text: Well, it isn't the Mother of All Magic, lucky for you. You look terrible. Are you eating?

SD_47.speaker: Gale
SD_47.text: I can look after myself, Tara.

SD_29.speaker: Tara the Tressym
SD_29.text: I have my doubts. But first things first...

SD_28.speaker: Gale
SD_28.text: Goodness, I'd forgotten. Thank the gods you reminded me before I starved to death.

SD_32.speaker: Tara the Tressym
SD_32.text: I won't be teased, heckled, pestered, or vexed, Mr Dekarios. Not before I've had my due.

SD_42.speaker: Gale
SD_42.text: In fact, I think I feel as bad as I look.

SD_2.speaker: Tara the Tressym
SD_2.text: No matter, Mr Dekarios. Tara's here now, and she'll sort you out. But first, my payment.

SD_26.speaker: Tara the Tressym
SD_26.text: Ahhh, that's it. No one manages the nuances quite like you.
SD_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: She approaches Gale. He smiles,bends and scratches her around the neck. "Ahh, that's it..." At the end of the line, she returns to her neutral pose.

SD_33.speaker: Gale
SD_33.text: Dare I ask what you're doing here?

SD_22.speaker: Tara the Tressym
SD_22.text: Making sure you keep on the straight and narrow, as is my task in this weary life.

SD_4.speaker: Tara the Tressym
SD_4.text: I looked away for a moment, just once, and look where it got us. You, a living doomsday device. The shame.
SD_4.context: NodeContext: (She says this with an undertone of affection).

SD_9.speaker: Narrator
SD_9.text: *Nestled amongst your books and papers, Tara bore witness to your greatest triumphs... and your greatest failure.*

SD_8.speaker: Narrator
SD_8.text: *You made yourself a walking cataclysm, the annihilation brewing within you just about held at bay by your constant consumption of magical objects. Tara saw it all, but never left your side.*

SD_11.speaker: Tara the Tressym
SD_11.text: Speaking of which - I brought you something. For your tummy troubles.
SD_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Magic pocket - Tara teleport's an object into Gale's pocket.

SD_19.speaker: Narrator
SD_19.text: *A ring, coursing with magic. The Netherese orb within you shudders, longing to consume, to devour... It must be satisfied.*

SD_24.speaker: Tara the Tressym
SD_24.text: We have a great deal of catching up to do. Eat that, have a wash and, for the love of all that's dear, a shave. Then you can fill me in on what I've missed.

SD_45.speaker: Gale
SD_45.text: Thank you, Tara. I really needed this.

SD_6.speaker: Tara the Tressym
SD_6.text: Of course, Mr Dekarios. What else are friends for?

SD_20.speaker: Tara the Tressym
SD_20.text: Now eat up! If you explode and kill us all, I'll be furious.

SD_21.speaker: Gale
SD_21.text: I'm not sure, Tara. It's dangerous out here.

SD_0.speaker: Tara the Tressym
SD_0.text: All the more reason I ought to be looking after you.

SD_35.speaker: Tara the Tressym
SD_35.text: Anyway - incidentally - I was getting very bored without my friend.

SD_44.speaker: Tara the Tressym
SD_44.text: Handy little spell I've been working on. 'Tara's Catflap of Displacement.' I haven't worked out all the kinks, but I'm starting to be able to find my way around.

SD_14.speaker: Tara the Tressym
SD_14.text: It is terribly good to see you, Mr Dekarios.

SD_39.speaker: Gale
SD_39.text: You need to go home - now. And that's final.

SD_7.speaker: Tara the Tressym
SD_7.text: I don't take orders from my masseuse. Eat up, now. And chat soon.

SD_12.speaker: Gale
SD_12.text: It's good to see you, Tara. I've missed you very much.

SD_13.speaker: Tara the Tressym
SD_13.text: And I you, of course. The tower just isn't the same without you stomping about in the background.

SD_1.speaker: Tara the Tressym
SD_1.text: So here I am, come to re-insert myself. After all, remember what happened last time I let you out of sight?

SD_50.speaker: Tara the Tressym
SD_50.text: Of course you do. You're still paying the price with that ticking time bomb in your gullet. Ugh, the indignity.

SD_52.speaker: Gale
SD_52.text: Don't get used to it. You need to go back to Waterdeep. Now.

SD_41.speaker: Tara the Tressym
SD_41.text: Wizards ask questions, they don't issue imperatives. You ought to know that by now, Mr Dekarios.

SD_54.speaker: Tara the Tressym
SD_54.text: But I suppose your case is worse than I thought. All the more reason for me to stay and keep an eye on things. We wouldn't want you to make another apocalyptic mistake, would we?

SD_36.speaker: Gale
SD_36.text: Well, well, well. Look what the tressym dragged in.

SD_27.speaker: Tara the Tressym
SD_27.text: I know, I'm looking exceptionally well. You, on the other hand - how the tidy have fallen. Are you eating?

SD_18.speaker: Gale
SD_18.text: You promised to stay in Waterdeep. 'Promise,' verb, meaning to swear something will or will not be done.

SD_3.speaker: Tara the Tressym
SD_3.text: And I decided 'will not'. And a good thing, too. You look like you haven't had a good meal in days.
SD_3.context: NodeContext: With mother hennish but irritated concern.
